body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of California:
examples: Notwithstanding a few notable exceptions, Kings Canyon National Park doesn't have the big trees, but compensates with a gaping canyon gored out of the rock by the Kings River.
In 2005, wreckage was found in Kings Canyon National Park from a plane that went down during World War II.
